Reviews.Title: “Basic inexpensive accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Sooperstar100
Reviews.Content: This was adequate for what we wanted for one night but the rooms and hotel in general are very basic with no toiletries. The carpets and fixtures were tired and damaged but everything worked. There were only 2 thin pillows provided but I am sure we could have asked for others. The thing which really makes this hotel rise up is its staff however - they could not have done more for us or been more welcoming. When we asked for more tea and coffee we were showered in both! Room was quiet and reasonably spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Just good value.”
Reviews.Author: peterandjenny282
Reviews.Content: On arrival staff very friendly,asked for extra pillow, no problem, room basic but clean and it all worked, plenty of tea coffee milk and sugar. The place does need updating but who is complaining at under £50.00 a night for a double room and parking outside your door. The place was full and people do vote with their feet. There were a few white vans outside at night , these guys wouldn't stay if it wasn't any good.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, in need of a refurb”
Reviews.Author: QueenBSheffield
Reviews.Content: On a positive side the bed linen and bathroom were clean, but the carpet was stained, windows were filthy, corridors were tatty and desperate for a lick of paint everywhere! The hotel was a long way from the station, although there was a bus stop nearby. I certainly won't be rushing back here!

Reviews.Title: “Nooooooo”
Reviews.Author: Lesley3405
Reviews.Content: This was booked last minute after getting X Factor tickets, we assumed Wembley meant it was close to the Stadium....Nooo there are many places closure. Check in - free for all, one bloke, very slow, looking confused.... Stairs to room - Like a Multi Storey Car park with fag ends, rubbish and ooooh the smelllllll.... Corridor - Major trip hazard, carpets are way to big for the space they have been fitted into. Room - When you lie on the bed the mattress wraps round you, one pillow, one light, so its tough if you want to read in bed. Breakfast - Avoid, we sat down, assumed it was free then half way through my toast a lady came over to ask for payment. Taxi Service - ripped off, £14.00 turned into £25.00 to the Stadium,we had to threaten the police if the bloke carried on. I suppose £65.00 for 2 isnt bad but it does need vast improvements....its miles from the tube to!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COST”
Reviews.Author: Broomfield19
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe that Travelodge have the nerve to keep this place open. I use hotels for business approx 150 nights per year. This place has to be the dirtiest most disgusting hovel I have ever had the misfortune to stay. When I complained about the filth in the bathroom it was met with 'Whatever' I complained in writing to travelodge and have as yet still not rec'd a reply. AVOID AT ALL COST!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what the doctor ordered!”
Reviews.Author: RogerNewberry
Reviews.Content: Great, low cost hotel situated just where I need it. No frills, no big bills.

Reviews.Title: “Just what it says it is”
Reviews.Author: frank20034
Reviews.Content: Efficient and friendly check-in. Good value when special deals available. Quiet and clean

Reviews.Title: “dreadful”
Reviews.Author: scotlassMoray
Reviews.Content: The travelodges seem so have gone right down hill, this one was awful carpet filthy,mold all over bathroom,paint chipped everywhere,and on and on.We asked to move rooms and were told we had to wait until next day,then next room was just as bad.The standard has gone down on all travellodges but this one must be the worst.Or do you know others worse?dont go until it has been refurbished.You used to know what you would get at lodges as they are all the same, but not now.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: honestandtothepoint
Reviews.Content: We stayed here so we was near to a wedding we was attending in streatham hill! I got it cheap and was worried about staying with the reviews but we were pleasantly surprised. The staff were very friendly and helpful and provided us with extra pillows and tea & coffee when we needed them. There is also a coffee machine in the reception area with a selection of hot drinks at a reasonable price of Â£1.70. The room was clean, bed was comfortable, door locked, tv was a modern flat screen with digital channels. There is a harvester pub in the same car park as the hotel is on and we went in for a drink that seemed ok! Our room was overlooking the pub and we heard no noise at all. My only negative comments are the room was very warm and the shower was not very good it trickled so was bot very good for washing my hair! But apart from that we had a very pleasant stay it's a very nice hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be returning”
Reviews.Author: JohnTubs1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with my wife and 9 year old son while visiting family nearby. Booked this hotel because we knew it was very convenient to the family we were seeing and with it being a Travelodge felt confident that it would be adequate as a base to sleep. We were all disappointed with the standard of our family room. They were experiencing 'maintenance' problems while we were there and explained that we had been allocated a different room to the one we had originally been assigned, but that it was of the same standard. If the rooms are all of the same standard than I would be very surprised if they had any repeat business. It was so tired and worn and in desperate need of refurbishment. We weren't expecting luxury but this pushed 'no-frills' to the limit. The bedding was clean but the double bed and sofa bed needed replacing, the main bed had a major dip in the middle and the sofa bed was very scuffy. The bathroom was equally tired. I emailed Travelodge on our return with my views and responded to an email request for feedback and have yet to have any response after 4days. All in all a most unsatisfactory stay. In closing I must also mention that if you booked here thinking you were in Wimbledon or able to walk there than you would also be disappointed as you are some distance away. In desperate need of refurbishment!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Clean and Staff friendly”
Reviews.Author: valsy2002
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this hotel I was very concerned about this hotel. However, when we arrived, the staff on reception were very friendly. The hotel is attatched (across the car park) to a harvester restaurant where the food was lovely and the staff friendly and chatty. It is resonably priced and also do a great breakfast for Â£3.99 for the full works. The room was basic and to be fair, a little run down, but it was clean and had everything we needed for a couple of days in London. The next morning, the reception staff were again friendly and the girl went out of her way to help with directions to the park and ride for Wimbledon tennis (which is literally, just around the corner, Â£4.50 each return). Overall, we would definately stay at this hotel if we return to watch the tennis at Wimbledon. The park and ride is convenient, the harvester lovely and the travelodge itself basic, clean and everything you need for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our weekend!”
Reviews.Author: LMUNN
Reviews.Content: The most disgusting hotel room i have ever walked in and straight out of again!. Were shown our room of which we'd paid "Â£80" for bearing in mind this was one of the cheapest rooms, were told that they didn't do "Â£29" rooms yet its advertised all through the hotels that they do. Walked into the room it stunk of bleach to the point that i couldnt have stayed there for that reason alone it was a simple clean bleach it was a full on inhailing bleach smell!. The curtains didnt pull, the bed was covered in white stains, the bed sheets werent pulled on properly, the walls were all dented marked and chipped, the window ledge was furry from mould and the windows did not open, the bathroom was dirty, there were hairs in the bath, fur around the seal of the bath, tiles were all smashed and black in cracks. LITERALLY A BED IN A ROOM! (no kettle, fridge, hairdryer, cup.) not even for Â£80!!! Walked straight out and asked for a refund , were told that refunds were not given after 12pm, It was now 2pm. Cannot understand how refunds arent given after 12pm when you can't actually arrive at the room or check in until 3pm alone!?. In the end we were shown another room which was exactly the same and had to face the prospect of either staying in this hotel very unhappy and ruin our weekend, or move hotels and pay another Â£80 for a hotel in which we have stayed i before loved except it was a little out of the way. We went to the other hotel and had a fantastic night the only downfall was being out of pocket but it was worth it, and we got a breakfast included in the price i cannot emphasis how amazing the hotel we stayed in was either and it was CLEAN!. I was so devistated at this hotel that it didnt even cross my mind that i should have taken photos of the room, for anyone else who still risks staying there i strongly advise when you do walk back out again that you take pictures and get a full refund!

Reviews.Title: “What a Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: tomthumb21
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say that other reviewers have not already said, yes this is only a Travelodge but for the price we paid (55.65 for one night) we thought this was well over the top. Ok bed was clean enough but 1 towell between 2 people is not good!! why should guest have to asked for another towell they must have known there was 2 people staying when we booked. The bath needed needed something doing to it as it was not dirty but black in the bottom!! if it was enamal then it needs re enamalling . This place needs a real good makeover, it might then be passable. Very drab room not helped by poor lighting. Also as with another review batterys run out in tv remote. Was not to pleased at returning at 12.20am to find main door wide open and no sign of any reception staff, any old Tom, Dick or Harry could have walked in, so security did not get 10/10 from us. If we had to stay here again would only do so If THEY PAID US!!!! Surprise,Surprise we will not be returning!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: DaisyCowCornwall
Reviews.Content: My sister and I only picked this hotel as we had a funeral to attend in this town and this was the only hotel in the area we could find online. We had read the bad reviews but thought as these were last years then Travellodge would have noted these and updated the place. This travel lodge was the worst I have stayed in. It was so dated, dirty and unwelcoming. You have to walk through the Harvesters car park to get to the Travel lodge which is hidden away at the back. (it had snowed heavily but no one had cleared the road or entrance) The entrance was not lit nor was the sign, we didnt think it was open to begin with. Once inside we noticed that the fire exit door has been kicked in a few times (that worried us to start). Our room was spacious but only the double bed made up in Family room, we had to go back down and ask for extra bedding for the 'pull out' bed and for extra towels (only one provided). We had booked a family room (they didnt have a twin available) which sleeps up to four so why would you only make up one bed and leave one towel ??? The decor was very dated and the only heating was from a very old and grubby looking electric heater on the wall. We had to use our own batteries for the telly as the ones provided were dead. ... One tiny plus would be that it was quiet (being off the main road) but definately not worth the money charged.

Reviews.Title: “We got more than what we expected. The staff was very helpful and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: caley1000
Reviews.Content: We had to book a room at this hotel at last minutes as there was no room available in this area. We read many reviews on Tripadvisor after the booking thus was very disappointed. When we get there, the staff was very friendly and helpful. We received the good service that we never expected in a budget hotel like Travelodge. We definitely will come back, not because of the hotel, but because of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ThurmanBTameBank
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week. The hotel needs refurbishment. However, the room we stayed on first floor was clean and basic. We booked a family room for 4 people. The staff was friendly and very helpful. They provided good service and made us feel comfortable. What else do you expect from a budget hotel with Â£29 for 4 people?

Reviews.Title: “An absolute kharzi. One of the worst hotels I've ever seen. Avoid.”
Reviews.Author: BenjiBunnyBoy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many Travelodge hotels and generally regard this chain as excellent, and in terms of value for money, probably the best. So it came as quite a shock when I walked through the front door of this establishment. The reception and common parts looked grotty and smelled uninviting. Peeling paintwork, tatty carpet tiles, exposed wires and piping should have warned me off there and then. But as my partner and I didn't arrive until after 10pm and without a car, there was no choice but to check in. Still, as long as the room was reasonable and we could get a good night's rest, we wouldn't care. Oh dear, oh dear! Well too start with the so called "family" room we booked smelled of cigarettes. Sorry, not smelled but reeked would be more accurate. It was redolent a 1970's boozer. Needless to say everything else was shabby. Sorry, not shabby but grubby, stained, flakey, cracked, mouldy, threadbare and broken. Although I generally don't bother to complain, the thought of having to stay in such a room, even for one night, sent me to see the man on reception to ask for a change of rooms. He explained that there were no rooms left and my room didn't smell of cigarettes, the musty smell(as he described it) merely being due to the room's age. He did however, offer me the use of a can of air freshener, kept conveniently to hand on the counter, as compensation. I declined his offer, having already sprayed a liberal amount of perfume to no avail. Resigned, I went back to my room. Other points to note were being unable to obtain change for the vending machine. We had to dial in a food delivery, just so we could get something to drink. The hotel not being situated near any conveniences precluded travelling anywhere on foot. Very thin walls and floors at least let you know you weren't suffering alone. Couldn't take a bath or shower, just too dirty. Television broken, obviously. And the stained duvet and mattress didn't really help any already unlikely attempts of romance with my partner. I feel generous giving it one star. Oh well, although it's marginal, at least I didn't have to sleep rough......

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: letsgiveitago
Reviews.Content: Awful, grim corridors , dirty room, a crisp in the bed!! Radiator coming off wall,loo seat coming off loo, tap leaking, furniture with holes in it, reception staff who didn't care and experts at how not to handle a complaint. " This is how we keep our prices soooo low!! " Rubbish , I have been in cheaper better maintained places. A very unpleasant experience. There was also a large tree that had fallen down outside and looked very unsafe and worrying.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the spiders”
Reviews.Author: Jack_hoots
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice before due to the location and stayed for 2 nights this time, room had about 5 large spiders in it all looking at me from the ceiling all with cobwebs. The walls are pretty thin and I couldnt sleep due to next doors chatting and TV, which wasn't particularly loud to begin with. no air conditioning. I did get the room on a good deal so that was ok. Asked for a room change due to the spiders which could not be done so i asked for a hoover and was given a feather duster and was explained that the rooms were cleaned daily (obviously some pepoles idea of cleaning is not others), so i cleaned all the cobwebs myself. Basic amenities...come on give it a lovely makeover, the secure straps on the windows had broken too, so anyone could jump out...i felt i wanted too after not being able to sleep due to the noisey neighbours and the staring spiders!

Reviews.Title: “Wont go back”
Reviews.Author: rosebudBridlington
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for two nights, chose it because it was near relatives, we have stayed in many travelodges before and know what to expect - cheap, clean and usually cheerful. But this one is next to a Harvester which has seen better days, it took two confused staff about ten minutes to check us in, and it is a bad sign whan even the armchairs in reception are worn away on the arms to the wood! one room didnt have a door closer (just big holes) a rail so bent in the wardrobe that the clothes snuggled together!, not a choice in the other room as we only had three coat hangers. The tiles in the bathroom were filthy, several lights weren't working and the curtains were torn. Both nights we only had one big towel and one small, despite being in a family room, and because there was no restaurant we ordered the 'continental breakfast bag' for Â£4.50. If you are considering this option my advice is Dont do it! cereal like cardboard, milk like water, synthetic blueberries and a folding plastic spoon. the croissant should be sued under the trades description act, it was like a small unsweetened breadroll in plastic. So, sorry, I know it was only somewhere to lay our heads, we will use travelodges again, but not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Travelling around the UK save $$$ and stay at the best”
Reviews.Author: Partsman999
Reviews.Content: We regularly tour the UK and for the best possible value, one can book in advance with (insurance) for a double family room for $50 or less some do charge for parking, many are next to Little Chef kinda like Denny's . Many Travelodges are convieniently located to the great UK freeway network or the old A Trunk road network which means only minutes away from city centers and the great tourist sites, Bath ,Avebury ,Cambridge, London,Stonehenge, Brighton etc

Reviews.Title: “Shabby hotel in need complete clean and renovation”
Reviews.Author: Joan009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night with 3 other members of our family. We arrived early Saturday morning told reception we had arrived and would be leaving the car and going off into London and would not be back until late. They said they had 24 hour reception so could check in properly that night but even though no one was in the rooms if we wanted to go into them then we would have to pay Â£10 extra per room. Reception seemed friendly enough. There are 2 stations within walking distance of the hotel the main line is the closest and the underground about a 15 minute walk or you can get a 93 bus which stops outside. We got a day ticket on the underground and it took about 40 minutes to get to Tower Bridge. We were visiting the Tower of London which we really enjoyed and was well worth a visit. We then went on to Covent Garden which was buzzing with atmosphere at this time of year and then on to Regent Street to see the lights. We arrived back at the hotel at about 1130 and checked in. Reception friendly. There was a man in a wheelchair in reception which seemed like he lived in the hotel who told us it was a mistake staying here and don't eat the breakfast which we hadn't planned on as it was only a snack breakfast package delivered to your door and costing Â£5. We had breakfast the next day in a cafe close to the underground station called Villagers which is a small very clean cafe and we had a complete English breakfast for under Â£5 which was freshly cooked and excellent and can really recommend it. The hotel was very tatty, in complete need of a really good clean and needed docorating badly. The main problem we had was in my son's room. They used the toilet during the night and in the morning found it had leaked and flooded the bathroom from the sewage pipe behind the toilet (not very nice!) they could have gone to reception but it was eaier for them to use our bathroom as we were checking out quite soon. We reported the problem to reception and they took note and said it would be reported to the manager. All in all a very sad hotel which could be really nice if given a good clean, a coat of paint and a check over that everything is in working order. We intend to go to London again but would not stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Did exactly what it said on the tin”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireSkiers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights whilst visiting friends who live in Wimbledon. The room we had, 125, was on the upper floor and seemed to be in an extension. It had more modern furnishings than some of the rooms we glimpsed in. It was of decent size with a king-sized bed (too soft a matress for our liking.) Tea making facilities are provided. The flat-screen TV had the usual channels. Housekeeping was satisfactory. The shower room was clean and functional. Plenty car parking. The 93 'bus stops nearby and it's approximately 10 minutes walk to the nearest tube station. We paid Â£49 per night and were satisfied it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “musty, humid and no bbc1!”
Reviews.Author: ihatecinnamon
Reviews.Content: Ok, soooo I stayed here 1 night. 1 night was enough. At Â£70 during the wimbledon championships I thought it was fairly pricey. I was right, no air con.....that room had some serious heat building up in it, no toileteries, serious plug socket shortage, nearest one to the bed was across the room next to the tv. I was hoping to watch some tennis on the night after the live stuff i was viewing during the day, problem no digital tv, no available red button, no bloody bbc 1. Are you kidding me man. Sort it out travel lodge. Room reaches incredible heat during the day suggest not leaving laptop or anything chocolatey in there Bus stop no#93 is right outside the carpark. A little dark and dingy all in all. Internet at cost in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge - Morden, Wimbledon”
Reviews.Author: travellers_restUk
Reviews.Content: Use this travelodge and was over charged and still waiting for refund after 1 week. Customer Services a joke at both there call centre and the travelodge and with this experience we will now stop using travelodge because this is not the first time this has happened. Overcharged because there call centre took payment and then when we come to check in hotel said no payment was made and would not allow us to check in and so had to give payment details only to find they had charged us twice

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great for the money”
Reviews.Author: Officer_Dibble
Reviews.Content: Chose this motel because of its proximity to a funeral my wife and I were attending. Booked online about 3 days before the funeral and had to pay full price of about Â£65, as all the cheap deals had gone. The website told me I had the last room but a friend booked online on the day before the funeral and got a room without any problems. The motel description advised that there was quite limited parking. In fact, the hotel and the Harvester next door occupy a large plot and share a large car park, so parking was not a problem. The decor in the hotel and carpets etc were rather tired and needed a "makeover". However, our non-smoking double room was clean and comfortable and everything worked. Although there was a Harvester pub next door, it was not part of the motel and so the only breakfast available at the motel was a prepackaged continental offering at around Â£5. For what we paid, I felt that the accommodation was expensive. Unlike another motel chain you have to pay up front in full. There is an optional cancellation policy that you can purchase for Â£1. However, based on experiences with another Travelodge booking which I had to cancel, it is very difficult to get your money back. Would I stay at this motel again? Only if I could get a cheap rate deal.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some tlc”
Reviews.Author: fastsophie
Reviews.Content: We didn't book until a couple of days before our stay (maybe all the best rooms were gone?) So we didn't get a 'cheap' deal Â£66.00 for room only accomodation. We weren't expecting a palace, but were expecting better than we got..... On the plus side - the bed was comfortable, sheets were pristine clean, the room was a fair size. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. On the down side - the bathroom needs a deep clean or redecorating, looked yuk! Glad we were only there one night and could get home to our nice clean bathroom the next morning. There were dirty marks on the wall in the bedroom which looked like they could have been cleaned off. The curtains looked tatty. The aroma in the room wasn't pleasant - we wonder if this was a smoking room that had not been deep cleaned since the smoking ban was introduced? Really wished we had booked at the Holiday Inn - it was a little further away from the party we were going too, and a few quid more, but on reflection I'm sure it would have been nicer. On the whole it did the job we needed it to, a comfortable bed for one night to save us driving home from a party, but wouldn't stay there again, and as this was our first experience of Travelodge we would think twice about using them in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Accommodation on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: HelenJayne
Reviews.Content: As the old saying goes " You get what you pay for!" Paying just Â£45.00 for a hotel room on the outskirts of South West London during the Summer holidays - I didn't expect a 5* experience. I did expect decent, clean, standard accommodation with no frills but basic needs which is exactly what we got!! Whilst on holiday at my friends in Cornwall, we had planned a trip to an England footy match at Wembley as a treat for her son and two friends. All we needed was an over night place to rest our heads, somewhere the kids (12 and 18) would be comfortable and somewhere not too costly. The Travel Lodge fitted the bill! Driving the 4 hour trip from Bude, you want to ensure that there is ample parking so that the car is practically in reception. Ample indeed the parking facitlities are! Even in the height of the Summer hols the car was parked in seconds a couple of metres from the front door. Simple check in - bog standard reception area, bored looking staff but quick and easy. The rooms all on one level were situated nearby - the boys to the rear of the hotel overlooking Morden Park, us to the front overlooking the car park! All you would expect from a budget hotel; decent size rooms, standard bathroom with shower over bath, double/twin beds with very thin but 'can cope with' mattress and duvet, basic tea and coffee making facilities and TV with terrestrial channels. Generally a down to earth, basic almost Butlns style type of accommodation where you don't worry if the kids decide to use the bed as a trampoline for half hour or so!! We knew the area well having lived in the region for over 20 years - but if you don't then please don't be fooled by the name Travel Lodge Morden/WIMBLEDON! Wimbledon is in fact a good 15 - 20 minute drive in traffic and atleast a 45 minute walk even through the back roads. If you are coming to Wimbledon for the tennis or theatre - try Wimbledon town centre hotels such as the Phoenix or Antionette. You'll be sadly disappointed if you book in here and expect to be on the doorstep of SW19. Like many Travel Lodges, the Morden/Wimbledon hotel is in an 'out of town' location . Morden town centre is accessible by many buses along the main high road but is still a fair walk of 15-20 mins and has limited parking in the town centre if you are thinking of taking the car! On a high point - although booked on a room only basis, the hotel is directly opposite a very good Harvester restaurant should you feel the need for a hearty meal. The early bird menu offered great value for money traditional English /American dinner which the kids devoured. All in all a bog standard package. Generally very good value for money on a cheap budget but if the room rate exceeds 60 quid think about trying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “OK place”
Reviews.Author: thebride57
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place. The rooms where clean and very basic. Ladies beware no hairdryer or toiletries. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows excellent. The staff where very helpful and nothing seemed to be a problem. Bus stop round the corner No 93 this takes you into Morden right outside tube station. Morden is a 5 min bus ride, nothing much to do in Moden. Approx 18 stops to central London about 40 mins. There is a harvester in the car park which opens at 12.00, the food and prices looked OK. We stayed here as we where visiting relatives. They had a car so it was easy enough for us to get about. We paid Â£71 for a family room per night. Would I stay here again Yeahâ€¦â€¦â€¦

Reviews.Title: “ok cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: nalindap
Reviews.Content: Not bad, just needed somewhere to stay while on a course. Was efficient and clean. Nothing outstanding but nothing bad either. Good sized car park and a harvester next door which served good food. Useful to have the car park with london parking difficult.

Reviews.Title: “They think of everything!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Travel-Now which search engine came up with. Confirmation had right hotel but address for Travelodge Wellingborough. This took days to sort out but problem was with American based Travel-now as opposed to Travelodge who kindly thanked me for pointing out the fault. We went midweek for 2 nights as a base for Wimbledon. Staff were young but friendly enough. As the tennis was on we were charged Â£80 per night which had jumped up from the Â£46 quoted, albeit we were told this was the correct rate for Wellingborough. Think we were told we would be Â£79 and noted that room rate was'nt advertised in reception. The room had the basics but was in need of a clean, my wife having found half a tin of Vaseline which had been left under the bed. There was a light missing its cover and some dents in the walls. The bed linen was clean enough and bed was comfortable. As it was one of the warmest days of the year, air conditioning would have been nice and we slept on top of the covers. The shower was tempremental running hot and cold and the tap sprayed the water about. There was also a hole in the bathroom floor. Some biscuits with the tea/coffee would also have been nice as the price was for room only however the staff would have probably given if i'd asked but i had already been for teabags for the morning, extra pillows and towels.

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge London Wimbledon
HotelInfo.Address: A24, Epsom Road | Morden, London SM4 5PH, England
